fields.description:
A sequential tagger that uses a classifier to choose the tag for
each token in a sentence.  The featureset input for the classifier
is generated by a feature detector function::

    feature_detector(tokens, index, history) -> featureset

Where tokens is the list of unlabeled tokens in the sentence;
index is the index of the token for which feature detection
should be performed; and history is list of the tags for all
tokens before index.

Construct a new classifier-based sequential tagger.
fields.name: POS Classifier-based Tagger
Training Corpus
fields.description: A tagged corpus included with NLTK, such as treebank, brown, cess_esp, floresta, or an Annotated Document Corpus in the standard TextFlows' adc format

fields.name: Backoff Tagger
fields.description: A backoff tagger, to be used by the new tagger if it encounters an unknown context.

fields.name: Cutoff Probability
fields.description: If specified, then this tagger will fall back on its backoff tagger if the probability of the most likely tag is less than *cutoff_prob*.

fields.name: Classifier
fields.description: The classifier that should be used by the tagger.  This is useful if you want to use a manually constructed classifier for POS tagging.

fields.name: POS Tagger
fields.description: A python dictionary containing the POS tagger object and its arguments.
